abstract: World Health Organization declares Nigeria, country which accounted for half of all world’s polio cases in 2012, has conquered disease and it is no longer endemic there; says country must wait two years to pass without paralysis cases and no virus detected in sewage before it can be pronounced polio free.
lead_paragraph: Polio remains endemic in just two countries, Pakistan and Afghanistan.

headline.print_headline: Africa; Nigeria: Polio Contained, Health Organization Says

snippet: Polio remains endemic in just two countries, Pakistan and Afghanistan.
